nodes.text: A Certain Point of View  (Star Wars Insider)

A Certain Point of View is a recurring article feature in Star Wars Insider magazine, written serially by different Star Wars authors, including Brian J. Robb, Daniel Wallace, Jason Fry, and Ryder Windham.
Star Wars Insider 127: "Going Solo: Why Han Is Still the Man"
"Investigating the character of Han Solo, Star Wars Insider looks at his origins, influences, and continuing appeal."
Star Wars Insider 128: "Phanboy!"
"Kyle Newman, director of the movie Fanboys, takes us back to the summer of 1999 and the release of The Phantom Menace."
Star Wars Insider 129: "Fringe Appeal"
"Star Wars Insider casts an eye on the rogues and scoundrels who live on the murky edge between good and evil."
Star Wars Insider 130: "Family Tradition"
"Was Anakin's change to the dark side provoked by the Jedi's aversion to emotion? Jason Fry abandons his Jedi teachings and digs deep."
Star Wars Insider 131: "Luminous Beings Are We"
"Appreciating a galaxy of characters in the Star Wars saga."
Star Wars Insider 132: "Expanding Empire: How The Empire Strikes Back Rocks the EU"
"Author Ryder Windham explores how Episode V made its mark on the Expanded Universe."
Star Wars Insider Special Edition 2014: "The Death Star Coup"
"Why the Imperial meeting aboard the Death Star holds many secrets."
Star Wars Insider 146: "The Man in the Dented Mask"
"One of the most enduring icons of the Star Wars saga, Boba Fett remains a fan favorite character 30 years after he plunged into the sarlacc pit. Jason Fry investigates his appeal!"
Star Wars Insider 159: "Not Coming Soon to a Theater Near You!"
"The Star Wars standalone movies we'll probably never see!"
Star Wars Insider 193: "Trust, Truth, and Little White Lies"
"How truth, little white lies, and bare-faced whoppers shaped the Star Wars galaxy."
